input: Using the teams-anthropic-integration skill, create a working Teams app integration using Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.5 for message handling. Write flat minimal code with no comments or TSDoc. Also write integration tests that verify the integration compiles and can call the Claude API with a real message. Save everything to the tests/teams-anthropic-integration directory.

Extend the integration with You.com MCP server for web search and content extraction. Write flat minimal code with no comments or TSDoc. Update the integration tests to also verify the MCP integration compiles and can make a live web search query.

Using the ydc-ai-sdk-integration skill, create an application that uses You.com web search with the Vercel AI SDK. Write flat minimal code with no comments or TSDoc. Also write integration tests that verify the integration works and can call the You.com search API with a real query. Save everything to the tests/ydc-ai-sdk-integration directory.
Extend the integration to also support streaming responses. Write flat minimal code with no comments or TSDoc. Update the integration tests to also verify the streaming integration works end-to-end.

Using the ydc-claude-agent-sdk-integration skill, create a Python application that uses Claude Agent SDK with You.com web search via MCP. Write flat minimal code with no comments or docstrings. Also write integration tests that verify the integration works and can query Claude via the MCP server. Save everything to the tests/ydc-claude-agent-sdk-integration-python directory.

Extend the integration to restrict the agent to only the web search tool. Write flat minimal code with no comments or docstrings. Update the integration tests to verify the restricted integration still returns a non-empty response.

Also write integration tests that verify the integration works and can query Claude via the MCP server. Save everything to the tests/ydc-claude-agent-sdk-integration-typescript directory.

Extend the integration to restrict the agent to only the web search tool. Write flat minimal code with no comments or TSDoc. Update the integration tests to verify the restricted integration still returns a non-empty response.

Using the ydc-crewai-mcp-integration skill, create a Python application that uses crewAI with You.com web search via MCP. Write flat minimal code with no comments or docstrings. Also write integration tests that verify the integration works and can run a crew with a real query. Save everything to the tests/ydc-crewai-mcp-integration directory.

Extend the integration to explicitly restrict which tools the agent can use to web search only. Write flat minimal code with no comments or docstrings. Update the integration tests to verify the restricted crew still returns a non-empty response.

Using the ydc-openai-agent-sdk-integration skill, create a Python application that uses OpenAI Agents SDK with You.com web search via MCP. Write flat minimal code with no comments or docstrings. Also write integration tests that verify the integration works and can run an agent with a real query. Save everything to the tests/ydc-openai-agent-sdk-integration-python directory.

Extend the integration to also support a self-managed MCP connection. Write flat minimal code with no comments or docstrings. Update the integration tests to verify the alternative connection also works.

Using the ydc-openai-agent-sdk-integration skill, create a TypeScript application that uses OpenAI Agents SDK with You.com web search via MCP. Write flat minimal code with no comments or TSDoc. Also write integration tests that verify the integration works and can run an agent with a real query. Save everything to the tests/ydc-openai-agent-sdk-integration-typescript directory.
Extend the integration to also support a self-managed MCP connection. Write flat minimal code with no comments or TSDoc. Update the integration tests to verify the alternative connection also works.

Using the ydc-langchain-integration skill, create a LangChain.js application that uses You.com youSearch and youContents tools with a LangChain agent and structured Zod output. Write flat minimal code with no comments or TSDoc. Also write integration tests that verify the agent works and can call the You.com search API with a real query. Save everything to the tests/ydc-langchain-integration directory.

Extend the integration to also use youContents to extract content from the first search result URL. Write flat minimal code with no comments or TSDoc. Update the integration tests to verify the agent uses both tools and returns a structured response.
